alert.note: Alert for Coos; Curry; Douglas; Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 31 at 1:40PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Flood Potential Outlook for Coos, Curry, Douglas, and Josephine Counties.... Quick rises and possible flooding on area streams, creeks, and rivers due to the combination of heavy rainfall and snow melt in the following counties in Oregon... Coos, Curry, Douglas, and Josephine. A series of fronts is likely to bring periods of moderate to heavy precipitation totaling 2 to 6 inches of water to southwestern Oregon Monday, January 3rd through Wednesday, January 5th. Much of this precipitation is likely to fall as rain, especially Tuesday into Wednesday. The combination of the expected rainfall along with lower to mid-elevation snow melt will bring the possibility of flooding to the area. Currently, Deer Creek near Roseburg could reach flood stage later Monday into Tuesday and the Coquille River at Coquille could reach flood stage as early as Wednesday morning. Other rivers across the area are likely to rise significantly during that time period and it is within the realm of possibility that they could near or exceed flood stage, but it is too early to determine if they will at time. A flood potential outlook is issued when there is the potential for significant rises or flooding along rivers and streams. The exact scenario for flooding remains uncertain. This product will be updated as necessary. Watches and warnings may be issued by the National Weather Service if this situation worsens.
